Sidealterator¶

exception createcloth.verbesserer.class_side_alterator.NoLeftRightFound¶
exception createcloth.verbesserer.class_side_alterator.NoTranslationPossible¶
exception createcloth.verbesserer.class_side_alterator.SkipGeneration¶
exception createcloth.verbesserer.class_side_alterator.WrongAlterationFound(probleminteger, *args, **kwargs)¶
class createcloth.verbesserer.class_side_alterator.sidealterator(alterator_left, leftstartindex: int, alterator_right, rightstartindex: int, notes=None)¶

Alterator to alterate bth sides at the same time. Given a line number the alterator will look if it can alterate given strickgraph at this line Strickgraphs are not limitied to maximal size. There should be a limit of minimal width

classmethod from_graphdifference(source_strickgraph, target_strickgraph, changedline_id, maximum_uncommon_nodes=10, timelimit=None, soft_timelimit=0, soft_maximum_uncommon_nodes=None, **extraargs)¶

Uses twographs with alterated line

Parameters

  • source_strickgraph (strickgraph) –

  • target_strickgraph (strickgraph) –

  • changedline_id (int) – linenumber of targeted alteration

  • maximum_uncommon_nodes (int) –

  • timelimit (int) – Timelimit in secondes for algorithm to find uncommon nodes. Will be passed to extrasfornetworkx.optimize_uncommon_nodes

  • soft_timelimit (int) – secondary timelimit for find-uncommon-nodes

  • extraargs (Dict) – further options passed down to cls.__init__

replace_graph(mystrickgraph, linenumber, row=None, nodeattributes=None, edgeattributes=None)¶

mainmethod replkaces in graph at given line

Parameters

  • mystrickgraph (strickgraph) –

  • linenumber (int) – line in which alteration will be used

  • row – optimization. same as mystrickgraph.get_rows()[linenumber]

  • nodeattributes – optimization. same as mystrickgraph.get_nodeattributes()

  • edgeattributes – optimization. see code. generated from mystrickgraph.get_edges_with_labels()

  • row – use this to accelerate this method

Raises

FindError

class linetypepair(input_linetypelist: Iterable, output_linetypelist: Iterable, input_upedges: Iterable[int], output_upedges: Iterable[int], changed_line: int, startside: str)¶

helperclass for generate_from_linetypelist input. will only be used as iterable so instead iterable conforming to __iter__ can be used instead

replace_graph(graph, changeline)¶

Replace in given Strickgraph at given line. Gives back new strickgraph with replaced parts. Raises ‘NoTranslationPossible’ if replacement is not possible

Raises

NoTranslationPossible

Returns

Strickgraph with replaced parts
